item.title: Jessie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For it would seem - her case proved it - that we write, not with the fingers, but with the whole person. The nerve which controls the pen winds itself about every fibre of our being, threads the heart, pierces the liver." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Books are the mirrors of the soul." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "A woman must have money and a room of her own if she is to write fiction." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Yes: I am a dreamer. For a dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Wally Lamb
item.description: "Love is like breathing, you take it in and let it out." -- Wally Lamb

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Wally Lamb
item.description: "But what are our stories if not the mirrors we hold up to our fears?" -- Wally Lamb

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Wally Lamb
item.description: "Take what people give you. Drink their milkshakes." -- Wally Lamb

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Wally Lamb
item.description: "I know it's a crock of shit. I ain't offering you happily-ever-after. I'm offering you... happily-maybe-sometimes-ever-after. Sort of. You know, with warts and shit." -Thayer" -- Wally Lamb

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "The first draft of anything is shit." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All you have to do is write one true sentence. Write the truest sentence that you know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Wally Lamb
Jessie add a quote by Wally Lamb
item.description: "Accept what people offer. Drink their milkshakes. Take their love." -- Wally Lamb

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Wally Lamb
item.description: "He's splitting me open, I thought. He'll break me and then I'll die." -- Wally Lamb

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Wally Lamb
item.description: "A purple African violet so lush and fleshy it looked edible... his fingers as cool and smooth as beach stones." -- Wally Lamb

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "You cannot find peace by avoiding life." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jessie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "The eyes of others our prisons; their thoughts our cages." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jessie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "The only way out of the labyrinth of suffering is to forgive." -- John Green

item.title: Jessie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "When I look at my room, I see a girl who loves books." -- John Green
